result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert H Lyons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert H Lyons is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert H Lyons was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
DNA sample and DNA surcharge is mandatory and assessed if not already done.
Payment of the surcharges, costs, fees are to be collected by DOC from all applicable prison funds and wages; in an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable as well as during any applicable period of Extended Supervision.  Falure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Payment must be made by the end of the period of Extended Supervision.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration program and Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving two (2) years Initial Confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.

No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription. 
No contact with drug community.

Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens. No positive rsults.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armor or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

records.addlTxt: BAIL/REFUND NOTICE.

Defendant Robert H Lyons in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Robert H Lyons in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

State complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statement by Dannette C.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 6 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 3 years with credit for 115 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

- DNA sample and DNA surcharge is mandatory and assessed if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Payment of the surcharges, costs, fees are to be collected by the DOC from all applicable prison funds and wages, in an amount or a percentage which the Department determines is reasonable, as well as during any applicable period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment - payment must be made by the end of the period of extended supervison.  
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 2 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Letter from defendant, received and filed.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
D300
cf
and Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits, filed.

On the same day, at the hour of 10:45 a.m., the jury returned and by their foreperson, Robert S., brought in a verdict as follows:

"We, the jury, find the defendant GUILTY of Possession of a Firearm by a Felon, as charged in the Information.  Dated this 21st day of September, 2016.  Robert S., Foreperson."

On direction of the Court, deputy clerk polled the jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdict.  Verdict received and filed.  Court discharged the jury at 10:48 am.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Filed, Exhibit List, Jury Instructions and jury questions.    Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.

Defendant Robert H Lyons in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Robert H Lyons in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.  Jury in box at 8:37 am.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 9:25 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Leranth and Haldemann who were duly sworn for that purpose.   Jury in box at 10:08 am in response to a jury question.  Jury out of box at 10:11 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Wisconsin State Public Defender.
Wisconsin State Public Defender Eligibility Evaluation Form.
Filed.

Defendant Robert H Lyons in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Robert H Lyons in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.  Jury in box 1:45 pm.  Continued sworn testimony from Justyn MC.  Jury out of box at 2:45 pm.  Sworn Chazmon H., Milwaukee County Sheriff's Deputy Mark Metz.  Court held Colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify.  Defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right to testify.  Jury in box at 3:16 pm.  Defense rests.  Sworn for state as rebuttal witness: Assistant District Attorney Hanna Kolberg, Milwaukee Police Officer James Klusmann.  Exhibit #6 offered and received.   State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box at 3:37 pm.   Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box at 4:03 pm.  Court instructed jury.  Jury out of box at 4:17 pm.  Court recessed for the day.    Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 26.  Jury trial scheduled for September 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Robert H Lyons in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Robert H Lyons in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.  Jury in box at 9:00 am.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Detective Richard Fredericks.  Exhibits  #2, 3, 1 offered and received.  Stipulation by parties read by the Court to jury.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer James Klusmann.  Sidebar.  Sidebar.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Forensic Investigator Lee Vedbraaten.  Jury out of box at 10:26 am for break.  Sidebars put on the record.  Jury in box at 10:53 am.  Sworn for the state: DNA analyst Jill McDonough.  Exhibit  #4 offered and received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 11:21 am.  Exhibit  #5 offered and received.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  The Court appointed Thomas Flanagan to represent defense's witness Justyn MC.   Jury in box at 11:47 am.  Sworn for defense: Justyn MC.    Jury out of box at 11:59 am.  Court recessed for lunch.

Defendant Robert H Lyons in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Robert H Lyons in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Jury in box at 2:51 pm.  Voir dire continued.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Jury out of box at 3:55 pm for break.  Jury in box at 4:10 pm.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Jury out of box at 4:30 pm.   Court recessed for the day.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 26.  Jury trial scheduled for September 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert H Lyons in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Robert H Lyons in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     

On motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed.

Jury panel in court at 10:43 am.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 11:03 am.  Jury out of box at 11:52 am.  Court recessed for lunch.
